Everyone saying it better make their hair “pin strait” but she SAID she wanted the blown out look, not pin strait. So it doesn’t mean you can’t get that look. And yes it’s pricy, but the amount of research they did when creating this is what brings it to that price. If you are cutting out time, making the plates adapt to your hair, making it cordless, and doing your research on what the material is of the plates to support less hair damage, then it makes sense. If you look at other reviews, they go into more depth as to what the research results were. No shade on Nicole, I think she did a beautiful job, but I know other youtubers have done more in depth reviews if that is what you are looking for. A straightener STRAIGHTENS hair. It doesn’t vacuum your house or pay your bills. If you are looking for something to pay your bills, then you probably shouldn’t be looking at purchasing a straightener to begin with.
